context: The Finnish verb 'uskoa' is an active form meaning 'to believe', 'to trust', or 'to have faith in'. It's used when the subject performs the action of believing. This word belongs to a group of Finnish verbs that undergo consonant gradation (k changes to g) in certain forms - for example, 'uskon' (I believe) vs 'uskon' (we believe). The opposite would be 'ei usko' (does not believe).
